item.dc:creator: @Owner_Barter Owner Barter
item.description:
@Owner_Barter wrote:

You need to zoom in when your doing that,nobody can see that video…bit what you might not have done is click edit on your run server or compiler whatever is failing on you,and change the jdk in there to your version…If you want to be part of this community you need to learn this basic shit.You wont survive in this forum if you dont learn this.

item.title: Java on vista problem with run.bat (youtube video included)
item.dc:creator: @Beastly1 Beastly¿
item.description:
@Beastly1 wrote:

Are you a Standard user on your computer?

Sometimes, .bat programs might just randomly not recognize ‘Java’. Either because your a standard user and it won’t let you have access to Java, or your a standard user. I might be wrong.

If your a standard user on your computer, try sharing your server folder with the administrator, then go on the administrator account and run it there.

If you don’t have access to Java and it requires an Administrator password, fill it in and try to install it correctly.
If it doesn’t work, try to reinstall it. Make Sure you Jdk version is 6u2. Aka 6 update 2.

It worked for me, might not work for you.

And you already posted this here.

Read full topic
